### Tender Announcement: Beef Herd Veterinary Services
#### Nappan Research Farm, Nova Scotia
------
#### Solicitation Number: 01B46-22-099
Table of Contents 
----------------

### Purpose 
The Nappan Research Farm, a facility of Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada, seeks to procure veterinary services for its beef herd. 

### Scope of Work
The service provider will be responsible for providing both preventive and curative veterinary services for a diverse herd consisting of approximately 285 head, including breeding cows, replacement heifers, feeder calves and slaughter weight animals. 

### Contract Period
The contract duration will be for a basic year, commencing on January 1, 2023, and concluding on December 31, 2023. An additional two (2) year extension periods may be invoked, contingent on satisfactory performance and mutual agreement between parties. 

### Tender Details
Tenders will be accepted by email only, and all information requests must be directed to the Contract Officer. To be eligible, bidders must obtain the complete tender documents, including specifications and plans, through the government's procurement platform. 

### Mandatory Requirements 
- Bidders may only submit tender proposals via the government's procurement platform.
- All inquiries and information requests must be addressed to the Contract Officer via email only.
- A mandatory attendance at any site visit or meeting will not be required for bid submission. 
- The bidder's proposal must clearly outline how they intend to address the needs of the beef herd and support the objectives outlined in the tender documents.

### Evaluation Criteria
Submissions will be evaluated based on the following criteria:
- Technical capabilities of the service provider in relation to the requirements outlined in the tender documents
- Capability of the service provider to meet the needs of the beef herd
- Service provider's cost structure and approach to financial management

### Award Criteria
The contract award will be based on a cost and technical score. Preference will be given to bids that better address the needs of the beef herd, demonstrate lower costs and provide evidence of a stable financial position.
